fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to CONFSERVER-54083 and CONFSERVER-36182, when using the Info macro, below an right-aligned image, the same will overlaps the rendering of the image.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and in the editor, insert an image through *'+' > Files and Images*
 # After inserting the page, make sure to click on the option to *right-align* the image
 # Insert the Info macro below the right-aligned page, through *'+' > Info.* It should look like the following:
 !editor.png|thumbnail!
 # *Publish* the page

h3. Expected Results

The information inside the macro should be displayed below the image.
h3. Actual Results

The information and the macro will overlap the image:

!overlap.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * The panel macro will behave differently. The same will be auto-adjusted to the left side of the image.

 
h3. Workaround

Place the info macro above the image:

!above.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Info Macro Overlaps Image in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Space Watchers receive notifications on 'Page Deleted' even if the page is restricted

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On a Confluence space, add a user as a watcher of that space
# Create a Page
# Restrict it to only your view/edit
# Delete the page

h3. Expected Results

The user would be notified of the page being created but not of the page being deleted

h3. Actual Results

The user is notified of both events.
fields.summary: Space Watchers receive notifications on 'Page Deleted' even if the page is restricted
Allow excluding attachments when copying a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to indent lists anymore
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a Heading 1 text and press enter
 # Indent a level, insert a heading 2 text and press enter
 # Indent a level (to be at the same level as above)
 # Insert a list (bulleted or numbered)

h3. Expected Results

The list should be indented as image below:
|!expected.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Actual Results

The list is not indented, as you can see below:
|!current.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Not possible to indent lists

fields.description:
Hi,

I think the insert link dialog could be improved :
 * Add a browsing option to look for page in the space hierarchy, the current space, selected space, ...
 * Allow the search tool wildcard ( * ), it would list page titles

The browsing option exist to move page to order the space.

Thanks
fields.summary: Insert Link Dialog - Page Search

fields.description:
To export documentation as a single page, I use the include page macro to combine pages.

The Include Page macro could be improved :
 * Allow multiple search method
 ** Browsing the current space / a selected space
 * The current search is performed on all the space even when a space key is entered.
fields.summary: Include Page Macro

fields.description: Confluence users need a standard size box that does not change size based on the content it contains. It would help improve the experience when formatting layout to pages in order to reach a real WYSIWYG (what you see is what you get) editor.
fields.summary: Add to the editor a fixed size text box feature.

fields.description:
Summary

When a video is embedded on Confluence using the *Widget Connector* macro, the video has the option of Fullscreen. However, when clicking on the fullscreen button it does not work.

Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new page;
# Embedded a Youtube video using *Widget Connector* macro;
# Publish the page and click on the fullscreen button. 

Expected Results

An embedded video with the fullscreen option available 

Actual Results

The fullscreen option is disabled and when you click on Fullscreen button it displays the following message:
"Fullscreen is unavailable"
 !screenshotYtVideoFullscreenNotWorking.png|thumbnail!
Notes

This behaviour is presented in any Browser(e.g., Firefox, Chrome, Safari)

Workaround

There is no workaround
fields.summary: Youtube Fullscreen mode not working while using *Widget Connector* macro

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user has the option to [configure the email notification settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html] for the profile and also, control which pages/spaces will be watched by the same. As this is a manual process, the user would need to select each content to unwatch. 

 

Sometimes, when a company works with a couple of end users, it would be intuitive to contact the administrator to disable specific notifications for them and the same would need to teach the user on how to perform the operation. 

 

This is a suggestion to have finer-grained controls over emails sent from Confluence to end users. For example, either the administrator could remove the pages/spaces watched by the user automatically or the same could have a quick option to stop watching it. 

 

h4.Notes

In the Server edition of Confluence, a workaround is to [disable the system add-ons notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-globally-disable-e-mail-notifications-with-page-content-718670714.html]
fields.summary: Control Confluence Email Notifications for End Users

fields.description:
Would be nice to provide the customers a tool/notification system to inform about the changes in our products whenever a new update comes to cloud.

 

Due to the changes implemented on Cloud, the customer can struggle to find a way to achieve their goals. It can be caused by a new feature or a new workflow to perform an action.
fields.summary: Provide Customers with a notification system to inform about the changes in Cloud Applications

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
* If a view restricted page has a specific link to it on another page, it will display the following error message:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 14.25.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a *view restricted page* in Confluence;
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 14.38.39.png|thumbnail! 
# On another page, add a *direct link* to this restricted page;
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 14.38.26.png|thumbnail! 
# Have a user without access to this restricted page trying to access it by clicking on the direct link.

h3. Expected Results  
* User will be displayed the following message:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 14.29.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results 
* User is being displayed with the following message:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 14.25.31.png|thumbnail! 

* Besides that, all pages in the Page Tree become unresponsive, showing the same error message.
* On the console, the following message is displayed:
{code}
Uncaught Error: A definition of type "c" with the ID of "request-access-container" already exists.
    at c (VM447 batch.js:3231)
    at Object.f [as init] (VM482 com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-request-access-plugin:confluence-request-access-plugin-resources.js:5)
    at b.<anonymous> (VM446 space.viewpage.b87319dc78fcefcc120f-v28.js:1)
    at d (VM424 jquery-min.js:1)
    at Object.fireWith (VM424 jquery-min.js:1)
    at b.fire (VM424 jquery-min.js:1)
    at d (VM424 jquery-min.js:1)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (VM424 jquery-min.js:1)
    at VM447 batch.js:87
    at VM447 batch.js:47
{code}

h3.Workaround 
* Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Direct link to a view restricted page throws a "Something has gone wrong. Our team has been notified" error message

fields.description:
When using mentions in large organizations, or in organizations with distinct groups or sub-organizations, it can be very difficult to tell which specific user you have mentioned in a page.

In order to assist users in selecting the correct user the first time, we would like to see more of the user information provided in the autocomplete.

We would like to suggest populating the "company" information in the Confluence Profile when mentioning in Confluence.

Alternatively if the "Job title" from the Atlassian Account can be populated, that would work as well to empower users to improve the specificity of the mentions.
fields.summary: Provide more Information in mention autocomplete

fields.description:
.h4 Summary

In Confluence, on *Settings* > *Site Logo and Favicon* section, when the user import a logo(with max-height of 48px or further), the same is set automatically to 32px.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

* Go *Settings* > *Site Logo and Favicon*, and Import a logo with more than 48px.

h4. Expected Results

The logo should automatically set to 48px, as the image below.

!expectedLogo.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Actual Results

The logo has it max-height automatically set to 32px, as the image below.

!actualLogo.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Note

In the *Expected Results* section, the max-height has been manually changed through the browser developer tools.

h4. Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: The site logo max-height size of 48px is not working.

fields.description:
This suggestion is for a page template or attachment macro that allows upload of files or text available for view/edit/delete to some users only. 

With this "nomination form" functionality, while all users will be able to upload files or text to the page, the list of submissions should be visible to only some users chosen previously. 

Once the user with upload only permission submits the file, the user will not be able to view/edit/delete the file on the page. 

This would be used for nominations for awards or sending feedbacks, for example.
fields.summary: Attachment macro or upload template with restricted view/edit/delete permissions

fields.description:
Questions for Confluence: "Ask question" and "Search" buttons should be better positioned: the "Ask question" is positioned where one would expect a "Search" button. 

It confuses a lot of users who type in a search criteria and then accidentally click, "Ask question".
fields.summary: Confluence Questions: position of "Ask question" and "Search" buttons

fields.description: This is a regression of [Custom homepages do not load properly on Mobile Browsers|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58033]
fields.summary: Regression: CONFCLOUD-58033 - Custom homepages do not load properly on Mobile Browsers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for a word in plural (or any word with a final "s") on "What do you want to know?" will return no Question, even if there is a Question with that exact same word. Removing the final "s" will make the Question be listed. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud with Questions for Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add Questions for Confluence to your instance at https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/billing/addapplication
* Navigate to the Questions on the sidebar. 
* On the "What do you want to know?" box, type: What do do when the laptop hangs?
* Click on "Ask question". 
* Add the Topics > Save.
* Click on Questions on the sidebar.
* Type "hang" on the "What do you want to know?" box. 
* The Question you added with the word "hangs" will appear listed. 
* Now, type the exactly word of the question: "hangs". 

h3. Expected Results
* The Question "What do do when the laptop hangs?" will appear listed.

h3. Actual Results
* No Question appears. 

h3. Workaround
* Type the desired word with no final "s".
fields.summary: Confluence Questions: search can't find words in plural (or with a final "s")

fields.description:
!image-2018-05-09-09-23-00-999.png!

Situation: In the above example "sdf" is paragraph style and "Discussion Topics" is header1.

!image-2018-05-09-09-25-13-550.png!

If I put my cursor at the beginning of the header1 style line and highlight the entire paragraph of "sdf" and hit backspace the text "Discussion Topics" will change to paragraph style.

!image-2018-05-09-09-25-29-968.png!

Suggestion: Since I deleted the entire paragraph the header style should not change to the default paragraph style.
fields.summary: Do not change header style when backspacing entire paragraph above it

fields.description:
Headers are typically one continuous line of text.

Suggestion: When the cursor is on the same line as a header styled text (beginning or end of the line), then the user hits the return key to a new line the text style should change back to paragraph style where the cursor moves.

For examples see how MediaWiki works.
fields.summary: Change style to paragraph when adding new line to header

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When using the "Log in as user" button while logged in originally as an administrator, restricted Child pages will show on the page tree even though the user being logged in as does NOT have permissions to view.

This only seem to be persistent with restricted child pages. this does not seem to affect parent pages with restrictions.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 * Under a page in a space, created three child pages.
 * Set restrictions to two of the three child pages to be viewed only by one user (the Admin)
 * Navigate to User Management and log in as user "End User1"
 * Back to the space, initial view does not show the restricted pages.

h2. Observed behavior
 * Navigating to the parent page of the child pages in question shows the 3 pages in the navigation tree.
 * Clicking on any of the restricted child pages gives an error.
 * If the unrestricted child page is clicked, the other restricted child pages disappear.
 * This will happen consistently if we navigate out of the space and back again.

This screen capture shows details of steps taken to reproduce.

[^logasuser_pagenav_bug.mp4]
h2. Expected behavior

Restricted pages should not appear in the page tree while logged in as a user that restrictions apply to.
h2. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Restricted Child pages will show on the page tree when using "Log in as user"

fields.description:
In Confluence, the pages are tied to users when they are created. When someone leaves the company, a suggestion would be tied to the implementation of this suggestion where it would allow all the pages from a specific owner to be changed to a different one.

 

In this request, if the pages could reference users by its Job title (or other specific information) when someone leaves the company, we could just exchange which user would be the current employee on that Job and the same would become the owner of the pages.

 

This is a suggestion to allow the page owner/mentions to be tied to a specific information (Job Title) so when someone leaves the company, the impact would be discrete.
fields.summary: Option to reference a user by its job title on confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Any JQL containing "changed" operator will not work on the JIRA Issue/Filter macro.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# insert the JIRA Issue/Filter macro.
# Try to use any JQL containing the "changed" operator 

h3. Expected Results
The JQL should work.

h3. Actual Results
It displays an error (below) and doesn't display issues results.
 
h3. Notes
Tested with these JQL:
{code}
status changed to "In Progress" BEFORE startOfDay()
status changed TO "In Progress" DURING ("2018/04/01","2018/05/10")
status changed after startOfDay()
assignee changed after startOfDay(){code}
All worked on Jira.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround at this momment.
fields.summary: JQL containing "changed" doesn't work on JIRA Issue/Filter macro

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When including a page (into another page via a third party app) that has a dynamic macro in it, you get a different {{macro.id}} as a context parameter in the descriptor. The macro.id is defined in the descriptor as:

{code}
"url": "/macros/ui-textbox?&pageId={page.id}&pageVersion={page.version}&macroId={macro.id}&truncated={macro.truncated}&macroBody={macro.body}&size={size}&type={type}"
{code}

The expectation would be, {{macro.id}} is persisted and consistent when including them in another page, but you get an error:

{code}
Uncaught (in promise) {
"statusCode":404,"data":{"authorized":false,"valid":true,"errors":[],"successful":false},"message":"No macro found on content id : ContentId{id=137494529} with version: 1 and macroId: 371049b0-d5c3-42dd-a7f3-2bd8411d6dcd"}
{code}

h4. Replication Steps
- Install RefinedSpaces.
- Add/Edit a page
-- Add an Excerpt macro.
-- Add a UI Text Box macro inside the Excerpt macro.
-- Add enough of content inside the Text Box macro so that it will be truncated when delivered to RefinedSpaces server (I used two info macros).
-- Publish.
- Add second page
-- Add an Excerpt Include macro  with the page where you previously added the Excerpt.
-- Publish.

Expected result: The UI Text Box is shown on the page.
Actual result: An eternal spinner is shown.

This sounds like an error in RefinedSpaces but for some reason the macro id for the UI Text Box is not the same on the original page as in the Excerpt Include page. When RefinedSpaces tries to query the Confluence REST API {noformat}GET /wiki/rest/api/content/{id}/history/{version}/macro/id/{macroId}{noformat} it returns a 404 since the macro id is invalid.

For more information, please see linked supporting ticket
fields.summary: Including a page with macro, results in an inconsistent macro.id and 404

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when creating/editing a Blog Post/Page, the user can [invite members to edit the content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-edit-and-publish-724764831.html#Create,edit,andpublish-Collaborativeediting]. Recently, with the introduction of the new editor, the user can no longer edit draft that the same has been invited before publishing a Blog Post. Instead, the same will face a permission issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blog Post
# *Before* publishing it *for the first time*, share the draft link or send an invitation through the "invite to edit" feature
# Have invited user accessing the draft link

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to access and edit the draft before it's published 

h3. Actual Results
The invited user can not access the draft. The following permission message will be displayed:
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* After publishing the Blog, the user will only be able to access the draft only through the draft's URL
* After publishing the Blog, if the user tries to use the "invite to edit" feature, Confluence will share the Blog instead of the editor itself (the draft, so it can be directly edited) 

h3.Workaround
If there is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Invite to edit not working in Blog Posts before publish

fields.description:
Summary
XML backup fails when generating site backup using backup manager and error message below prompt on the screen.

Export error

Export in progress - not responding
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2018-05-08T07:16:06.662


How to Replicate
# Go to Backup Manager in confluence and generate a backup
# Choose Backup and with or without attachments checked
# The backup spining in a while and the error message prompt out.
# Looking at the logs, it seems like Confluence is not able to write the exportDescriptor file

Expected Result
Site backup successfully generated.

Actual Results
Backup finish with export error

"Export in progress - not responding/ Unexpected error during export has occurred"

 

Workaround
No workaround currently
fields.summary: XML Site backup fails in backup manager

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a maximum of 12 people can edit a page at the same time. This means that people can't enter the editor if there are already 12 other people editing the page, and will need to wait until someone leaves. In Confluence Server, administrators can increase or decrease this limit using a system property but this option is not available in Confluence Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a functionality in Confluence Cloud where administrators can increase or decrease the maximum editor limit.
fields.summary: Ability to set the Maximum editor limit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Android client doesn't show the whole comments if the page contains more than 25 comments.

h3. Environment

* [Android client|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atlassian.android.confluence.core&hl=en] v1.17.3
* Confluence 1000.0.0-3d3c5423d32

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Post 26 comments to an arbitrary page
# Open the page on Android client and check the page only contains 25 comments

 !Screenshot_20180508-164606.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The client retrieves the whole comments.
Or, the latest 25 comments are preferred if the client needs to have any limit.

h3. Actual Results
Android client only loads the oldest 25 comments.

h3.Workaround
Copy the URL from the share button and open it on web browser.
fields.summary: Android client only loads the oldest 25 comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Steps to recreate:
# Use Safari
# Install RefinedSpaces
# Go to space settings of a space
# Select RefinedSpaces as your current theme
# Go to "Overview" and then to "Pages"

Theming works for Chrome. See screenshot for reference. You can also view difference in: https://refinedtheme.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HR/pages
fields.summary: White space on page header when RefinedSpaces is activated (only defective in Safari)

fields.description:
In Jira, a filter displays multi-column select custom fields as comma separated - see CustomField in the screen shot::

!Screen Shot 2018-05-07 at 1.24.53 PM.png|width=1115,height=143!

In Confluence, the display is ambiguous as the values are displayed separated by spaces- scroll right to see in screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2018-05-07 at 1.24.38 PM.png|width=927,height=175!

The display should be consistent between the two applications and the comma is preferable as a separator as it is more definite.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro displays multi-select custom fields separated by spaces

fields.description:
Dev is rolled back to 0.0.15-2886 to help to unblock the backend pipeline.

This is a temporary blocker.
fields.summary: Block front-end from deploying to dev until the pipeline issue is resolved

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the [Jira Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] for Confluence, the user can insert a filter/JQL for the search of the macro. There, if you insert a custom JQL that would return only a single issue, and then, change the display from "Table" to "Single", the same gets converted to a JQL that included only "KEY = Example".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence page, click on *Edit*
 # Once in the page, click on the *Insert* button and search for *Jira* in the dropdown
 # Once in the macro parameters, make sure to insert a custom JQL. In my example:
{code:java}
 filter = "my filter" AND summary ~ "some text"{code}

 # In the *Display* options, select *Table* and *Save*
 # Now on the page, select the macro and click on *Edit*
 # Change the *Display* option to *Single* and *Save* it

h3. Expected Results

The macro should keep the same JQL being used.
h3. Actual Results

The JQL gets reset to the "KEY = example" format.
h3. Notes

This has been tested with a filter/JQL that would return a single issue, so the *Single* option could be used. A video has been attached to better understand the issue. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: JQL Query Reseted for Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
Currently, despite confirmation being required prior to the deletion of a space, we still see a number of accidentally deleted spaces.

One suggestion a support case on how to improve this process is:
 - Disable the ability to delete a space without re-entering the admin
password.
 - Automatically move deleted spaces to the archived spaces for at least
24 hours. Do not actually delete spaces if 24 hours have not passed.
fields.summary: Add extra confirmation steps to the space deletion process

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when using the [File List Blueprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/file-list-blueprint-937893647.html] to create a page with a specific name, an additional page called "File Lists" will be automatically created inside the space, as a parent page of the created page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a space, click on the "*+*" icon to create a new page
 # Select the *File List* blueprint from the creation dialog
 # Create a page with any title

h3. Expected Results

Only the page with the requested title should be created.
h3. Actual Results

An additional "File List" page is also created as a parent page new page for the specific one created.
h3. Notes

A video is attached in order to display the behavior.

 
h3. Workaround

Manually remove the additional created page.
fields.summary: File List Blueprint Creates Additional Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add a Confluence News macro to a page, you be able to see results from the preview but it's not visible on the page after you click on insert button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Confluence: News macro to a page
# Noticed that the preview got results. 
# Click on *Insert* button.

h3. Expected Results
* The results should be visible on the page.

h3. Actual Results
* The results are not visible on the page.
fields.summary: Confluence News macro is not working

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a section with a width constraint (e.g., 3-part section)
 # Insert a table
 # Add a few columns to take space
 # Type in the last column until the table reaches the width of the section
 # Table cell does not accept spaces, typed or pasted
 # Table cell does accept other characters and will expand to accommodate them
 # Responsive and Fixed tables
 # This is 100% reproducible in Safari; haven't tried other browsers

h3. Expected Results
 Text with spaces as the example below
 !expectedResults.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Not able to insert space and the text look, as the image below:
 !actualResults.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Works well on Google Chrome

h3. Workaround
 * Back up one character and insert a space between the last two characters
fields.summary: Cannot insert spaces into tables inside sections on Safari

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we are not able to use preformatted texts in blog editor since the last update. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Re-implement the preformatted setting in the editor.

h3. Workaround
Create the document on Confluence and then copy and paste the text on the blog page.
fields.summary: Implement text formatting style back to the blog editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Table of Contents macro, if the page has a document (as a PDF or any office document), and this document has any "Heading" style, the "Document", "PDF" and "Edit file" buttons will be shown in the table of contents index list.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Table of Contents macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert a Table of Contents macro (default settings)
# Insert some documents (1 per line)
# Insert some "heading" styled  titles
# Select the document and set it as any "Heading" style
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
Nothing would display for the document "Heading" or at least display the document filename.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the "Document", "PDF" and "Edit file" buttons, as shown below:
| !Screen Shot 2018-05-04 at 18.34.28.png|thumbnail! |

h3.Workaround
Remove the Heading style from the document file.

h3. Notes
The issue is intermittent, sometimes reloading the page will make it render correctly.
fields.summary: Table of contents macro lists document buttons

fields.description:
Our school works on an instance of Confluence Cloud, and my users would love to see a quicklink (or button) embedded - _by default_ – that allows one visiting someone's Personal Space the ability to jump over to that person's Profile.
 * the opposite functionality already exists - there is a hyperlink on every Profile to that person's Personal Space (i.e. assuming that person has created one).

_*{color:#FF0000}Easy, right?{color}*_

Hope you can make it happen!

 

Thanks,

Jim Barton

Harvard University
fields.summary: Profile button on Personal Space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Resolved inline comments still visible in the Mobile app

 
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud, Mobile app

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Post an inline comment (attached screenshots test1, test2 and test3)
 # Resolve this comment (attached screenshots test1 and test2)
 # Notice that the comment is not displayed anymore in mobile
 # Notice that the same comment will be displayed in mobile

 
h3. Expected Results

Resolved comments should not be visible, desktop screenshot

!Screen Shot 2018-05-04 at 17.16.18.png|thumbnail!  

 
h3. Actual Results

Resolved comments are still visible in the Mobile app, mobile screenshot

!31760145_10160400188460080_2518458974290837504_n.png|thumbnail!    !31922634_10160400188400080_7831925580684591104_n.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround available for the moment
fields.summary: Resolved inline comments still visible in Mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Use Case:

Reference another Confluence document from a different cloud account (e.g. documentation for a dependency). 
h3. Where this should be possible:

"Include Page" Macro
h3. The Problem

It seems the "Include Page" macro is limited to Spaces "owned" by the current cloud account. 

Can we allow including pages from public, external confluence spaces?
h3. Help Status

See [community question here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-can-I-include-documents-from-other-Confluence-Server/qaq-p/787429?utm_campaign=accept_as_solution_reminder&utm_content=view-answer&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm#M106618]
fields.summary: Include Page from Publically Accessible External Confluence Account

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Please, advise what are the possibilities for Ubuntu in case we require [Atlassian Companion-0.1.5 Setup.exe|https://companion-release-server--cdn.us-west-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/companion-release-server/releases/uploads/2e62c41a-69ae-432b-8c3c-32132e2621b7/Atlassian%20Companion-0.1.5%20Setup.exe] to be installed on our PCs? 

 

Looking forward for your advice!

BR,

Anastasiia
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion-0.1.5 Setup.exe for Ubuntu

fields.description:
In the previous editions of [Trello's Power-up Integration with Confluence|https://help.trello.com/article/1083-using-the-confluence-power-up] the user had the option to create a Confluence page directly from the card. However, this is no longer an option. 

 

This is a suggestion to have a method to create a page from a Trello card.
fields.summary: Option to Create Pages in Confluence from Trello Cards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users cannot attach images to a template however they are allowed to paste an image while editing it which is properly displayed in edit mode.
When saving the template, no error is thrown but the template does not save any change after the image is pasted.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Prevent copy pasting of images when editing templates or add an error message when performing an illegal operation when saving.
fields.summary: Improve error handling when using the template editor
Blocking FE rollouts while we investigating issues with editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Provide a counterpart of Jira's '/rest/api/2/user/picker' (capability to search by display name,key and email) REST endpoint in Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence counterpart of Jira's '/rest/api/2/user/picker' (capability to search by username,key and email)

fields.description: Some customer has teams all around the globe. For these customers is important that the pages templates displays on the customer session/browser language to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Pages Templates should automatically display in the user session/browser language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Firefox needs to download an unusual amount of data to render simple pages in Confluence.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page and open developer tools;
 # Select the network tab and *all*;
 
h3. Expected Results
 * The page should be rendered consuming few data;

h3. Actual
 * The page consumes an unusual amount of data to render the page. 

h3. Workaround
* Use Chrome since it consumes fewer data.
fields.summary: Firefox takes an unusual amount of data to render simple pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the introduction of the new blog post editor, the *Notify watchers* feature has been removed preventing users from performing silent updates on blog posts.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Either reintroduce the *Notify watchers* feature in the blog post editor or introduce a way to prevent spamming watchers on all updates.
fields.summary: Re-introduce a way to prevent notifying watchers on blog post update

fields.description:
Summary
 * User tries to add a Global template to a *create from template* macro inside a global template, the user has to specify the SPACE key to populate the Template List.

 
 Steps To Reproduce * Create a Global Template
 * Insert a *Create from Template* macro
 * Specify the template you want to create from the drop-down list.

Expected Result
 * Template list will load with all the global templates.

Actual Result
 * Inside the macro, the user first needs to specify the SPACE KEY, and then the template list will be populated with all the global templates as well as the Custom Space Template. 
 * The user selects the required Template(Global/Space template) and deletes the space key and save the macro. 
 * When he tries to edit the macro, the template list will be EMPTY with no list populating the drop-down. *Video Attached* 

(i) When we try to create a page using this saved macro(with empty template list), the page will be created with the specified template we have given before deleting the space key.
fields.summary: Template list won't populate unless Space Key is defined in Create from Template Macro, inside a Global Template
Macro property panel controls does not get binded

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create *Created vs Resolved* Report is Jira Service Desk
 # Create sample page in Confluence Cloud
 # Insert a *JIRA Chart* macro or the *Created vs Resolved Chart*
 # Set it to 30 days > Publish
 # Compare JSD *Created vs Resolved* report with the *Confluence Macro*. Reports will be close but not exactly the same

h3. Expected Results
 * Report to match up

h3. Actual Results
 * Reports are different in colors and values. See example below

!Confluence.png|thumbnail!

!JSD.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * None at this time. The Created vs Resolved chart is a bit closer than the JIRA Chart Macro in Confluence, but the values and styling is not 100% the same as Jira Service Desk
fields.summary: Match Jira Chart Marco with JSD Reports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to use the *Syntax Highlighting* configuration for *Powershell* in the [Code Block Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/code-block-macro-724765175.html], the highlighting does not work properly. Specifically, only the second half/part of the command is being highlighted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence
 # Under the macro menu (plus icon), select *Other Macros*
 # Search for the *Code Block Macro*
 # Once the macro is on the page, insert a Powershell code, click on it and *Edit*
 # On the *Syntax Highlighting* drop down, select *Powershell*

h3. Expected Results

The Syntax Highlighting should properly highlight the command, not only a part, as the example below:

!powershell.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The macro highlights only a part of the command:

!macro.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting Issue for Powershell in Code Block Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the help menu, at the sidebar, there're two links for Questions:
* one leads to wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/*questions*?user.key=(...) 
* and the other leads to wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/*questionsViewer*?user.key=(...) 

but they have the same title (Questions), causing some confusion on what's the difference between them. Check screenshot below:
| !questions_double_link.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the links' titles to give more details and prevent confusion.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Duplicated titles for Questions links on the help menu

fields.description:
In the [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-765593817.html] documentation it is mentioned:
{quote}If your custom fields don't exist yet in Jira, the importer can automatically create them for you.
{quote}
But it is not possible to do so in the bulk create issues feature.

The option of creating custom fields requires Jira Administrators permission.
 And the bulk creation of issues is available for non-admins as well, hence, the importer won't offer the option *New custom field* as it offers when using the *External system import* feature.

The importer creates the mappings, but only to existing fields in Jira.
fields.summary: Creating issues using the CSV importer documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to access a blog post on Internet Explorer, the following error is displayed:
{quote}
Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{quote}

h3. Environment
Internet Explorer version 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence
# Access previously created blog post

h3. Expected Results
* Should be able to access blog post

Actual Results
* An error message is displayed when accessing blog post.

h3. Workaround
Acess blog posts using a different browser.
fields.summary: Error message when accessing a blog post on Internet Explorer

fields.description:
The documentation [Specifying field behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/specifying-field-behavior-776636443.html] explains how you can control the fields in Jira trough the field configuration.

But it is not clear on what exactly will happen if you hide a field.

I do believe that this is mentioned in the following part:
{quote}
Fields hidden through the field configuration will be hidden in all applicable screens, regardless of whether or not they have been added to the screen.
{quote}

Even though, it could be more specific for customers in my opinion.

When you hide a field, it won't be possible to perform JQL searches for it (there will be no results), and some feature that need to fetch for the field's data won't work either.

For example: if you hide the *Time Tracking* field in the field configuration, it won't just not appear from the screens, but the estimation in boards (in the backlog) will display the value as zero since the field was taken out of context.
fields.summary: The  effects of hiding a field in Jira

fields.description:
Dear Sir/Madame, 

Would you be able to add a feature that would allow us to sort the stories by likes? That would be a very useful functions. Thanks.

Best,

Le
fields.summary: Sorting Likes Count from high to low

fields.description:
To replicate:
1: Enable anonymous access globally for a Confluence tenant
2: Log in as a user who exists on a site, but is not in any groups that would grant them Confluence access
3: Attempt to browse Confluence as that user

You will see the Confluence UI, with not permitted messages.
fields.summary: Users who are members of a site but are not licensed do not have access even when anonymous access is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding macros through markup stops working if you delete your previous search

h3. Stepts to Reproduce

# On a Confluence page, in Edit mode, type {
# Type some characters as if you were searching for a macro
# Backspace to delete these characters until there's only the { left
# Start typing the name of an actual macro (e.g. "Trello", "Live Search")

h3. Expected Results

* Search would fetch the macro by its name

h3. Actual Results

* Search stops working and gets stuck. 
If you hit backspace at any point after that, it will erase everything that was typed after the {

h3. Workaround

Use the macro browser.
fields.summary: Adding macros through markup stops working if you delete your previous search
Backspace deletes contents in other table cells

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user clicks on the magnifying glass in the sidebar, it will open the Quick Search field and it will allow the same to search for multiple contents like pages, attachments and configuration options.

 

However, in those parameters, the labels are not included and this could be really useful to work with quick results and not consume time by going to the search page and configure the label parameters. This is a suggestion to make the labels searchable in the quick search of Confluence.

 

h4.Workaround

Use the full search of Confluence. Under the *Add Filter* part, make sure to select *Labels*.
fields.summary: Ability to Search for Labels with Quick Search

fields.description:
Currently, users have no way to add themselves as watchers of the [*What's New* blog page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog#].

When they click it, it automatically set them as a watcher of the whole space.
fields.summary: Allow users to add themselves as watchers of the Whats New page

fields.description:
h3. The problem
Copying a page that contains an Excerpt Macro that fetches data from pages with ":" on its name, breaks the macro.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page with a name that contains ':' ie. "This is the page: Test"
# Now, insert a {{Excerpt Macro}}, and type something in it
# Create a new page, in the same level as the one above
# Insert a {{Excerpt Include Macro}} on the page, and put the following parameters:
{code}SPACEKEY:This is the page: Test{code}
# Publish the page
# Now, copy the page and publish it

h3. Expected Behavior
The copied page will be published and the {{Excerpt Include Macro}} will display its content

h3. Actual Behavior
The macro strips out the {{SPACEKEY}} from its parameters, so it interprets the first part of the "This is the page: Test" page as the Space, breaking the macro and displaying: Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include': No link could be created for 'This is the page'.
fields.summary: Pages with colon on its title breaks Excerp Include macro on page copy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Multi-byte characters get garbled in template after saving page.

 !Screenshot 2018-05-01 14.38.34.png|thumbnail! 

This happens in both settings page:

* (x) "Global Templates and Blueprints"
* (x) "Space Settings" > "Templates"

And, both types of template:

* (x) "User Created Templates"
* (x) "Blueprint templates"

h3. Environment
Reproduced on latest major browsers (all are supported):

* Safari Version 11.1 (13605.1.33.1.4)
* Firefox 59.0.2 (64-bit)
* Chrome Version 66.0.3359.117 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template whose title is "あいうえお" and body is "かきくけこ"
# Save the template
# Check the contents are garbled like {{ããããã}}
**  !Screenshot 2018-05-01 14.41.30.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results

Users can create templates which contents consist of multi-byte characters.

h3. Actual Results

Templates created in multi-byte characters are garbled.

On browser:
* No console errors
* No invalid responses (4xx-5xx) in network


h3. Notes

Collateral cases:
* (x) The page created based on the affected template also gets garbled
**  !Screenshot 2018-05-01 14.55.59.png|thumbnail! 
* (x) Editing existing blueprint (such as "File list") also gets garbled
**  !Screenshot 2018-05-01 14.52.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Templates created in multi-byte characters are garbled

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the editor and insert an Info macro
# Enter multiple lines inside the macro
# Use the up/down keys to move between lines

h3. Expected Results
The cursor will move to the line above/below the current line

h3. Actual Results
The cursor gets out of the macro
 
h3. Notes
* Reproducible in Warn macro, too
fields.summary: Unable to move between lines by up/down keys inside info macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Site Homepage" setting under 'Further Configuration' in Administration is used to set which page should load when clicking on the Confluence site logo in the top-left corner. When the user in currently in 'Activity' or 'Your Work' page and then try to go to site homepage by clicking on the Confluence icon, it still takes the user to the 'Activity' or 'Your Work' page instead of the actual site home page.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set Confluence's Site Homepage in Further Configuration to a specific space instead of the dashboard
 # Click the site logo in the header, note that you're taken to the specified space's homepage.
 # Got to 'Activity' page, and then click on the site logo at the top-left corner.

h3. Expected results

You're taken to the space/page specified in Further Configuration.
h3. Actual results

You're taken to the 'Activity' or 'Your Work' page.
h3. Notes

This happens even when opening a new tab. 
It seems that Confluence saves the last visited page and reopens it instead of the Site Homepage.
h3. Workaround

Click on the Site Homepage shortcut at the sidebar.
fields.summary: Site Homepage setting not working from Activity page
Cannot comment on pages created with Fabric Editor
More than 100 space shortcuts on a space causes performance issues

fields.description:
Currently, *adding, removing and editing page restrictions* on a Space is quite time consuming and not user friendly for Confluence administrators, especially if there are many restrictions to add/remove/edit for multiple pages. 

h5. Suggested Solution
Provide a solution, such as a dashboard, in order to easily add/remove/edit many page restrictions.

h5. Workaround
At this moment, it's necessary adding/removing/editing page restrictions on each page.
fields.summary: Bulk update page restrictions: add, remove, edit page restrictions
Enable Spanish Indexing Language in General Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user logs out, the cache of available users is not purged
h3.  Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to a site
 # Logout from that site
 # Log in to a new site
 # Try to mention someone by typing @ and notice that the users from the other site will also be suggested

h3. Expected Results

Only users within a site should be suggested to be mentioned.
h3. Actual Results

Old users within the initial site will also be suggested to be mentioned.
h3. Notes

The user actually will not able to mention user from another platform, but just insert a text that is like a mention.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available for the moment
fields.summary: Cache is not leaked between sessions in Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user is deactivated, an update is pushed to the *All updates* tab stating that the personal space for this user has been created (using the actual creation date) by Anonymous.
Actually, this update is sent because upon deactivation, Confluence updates the personal space details.

h3. Suggested Solution
This update on the *All updates* tab by an Anonymous user is confusing to end users.
If the update cannot be removed, it would be better to have a less confusing message such as _Confluence updated the personal space xxxx due to user deactivation_.
fields.summary: Make the space details update more user friendly when deactivating a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a page to PDF, big images inside a table are downsized to half the cell's width. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a table in the page with two rows and some lines
# Insert big images (1200px) into the second row cells
# Publish the page and export it to PDF 

h3. Expected Results
The PDF will render the images in the same size as in the page.

h3. Actual Results
The image is downsized to half the cell's size:
||Page||PDF||
| !page.png|thumbnail! | !pdf.png|thumbnail! |
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Big images in a table are downsized in the PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a user will eventually be logged of from a pinned tab.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a user session to remain in a pinned tab.

h3. Workaround
Use bookmarks instead of pinned tabs.
fields.summary: Allow user to stay logged on pinned tab

fields.description:
Page layout button is missing from the blog editor in Confluence.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create a new blog or edit an existing one.
 # Attempt to adjust page layout by clicking the _page layout_ button

h3. Observed Behaviour

The option to select _Page Layout_ is not currently available.
h3. Expected behavior

The user should be able to select a _page layout_ in the blog editor.

 

 
{panel:title=Update from Atlassian on 2/21/2019}
As per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html,] you can now use columns to blogs. They are now referred to as Columns and can be added via the + menu or by typing in "/columns".

Thanks,

Avinoam Zelenko

Senior Product Manager, Confluence Cloud
{panel}
fields.summary: Reintroduce page layouts to the blog post editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

User unable to add the attachment to the blog. The option to add the image is missing and drag&drop is not working.


h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a new blog
# Try to add Image


h3. Observed Behaviour

There is no option to add the attachment

h3. Expected behaviour

The user should be able to add the attachment to a blog.
fields.summary: Unable to add attachment in Blog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A link that leads directly to a space doesn't work on the mobile browser.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Mobile browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a link on the page
# Select Search and search for a space
# Select the space (not the space overview) as shown below 
| !link_search.png|thumbnail!|
# Insert the link and save the page
# Try to open it using the mobile browser

h3. Expected Results
The link should lead to the space

h3. Actual Results
An error screen is shown saying "That page ID is invalid" as below:
|  !error_screen.png|thumbnail! |
 
h3. Notes
It works on the desktop browser.

h3.Workaround
There're two options:
# Select the space overview instead of the space when creating the link
#  Use web link and insert http://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACE KEY>/overview
fields.summary: Link to a space doesn't work on mobile web

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the customer tries to perform an undo action with Edit>Undo on macOS or right click > Undo on Windows in a confluence page it *undo* the previous action instead of the one you trying to *undo.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Insert a word;
2. Delete a different word;
3. Change the formatting on a third word to make it bold;
4. Undo using one of the following methods *right click > Undo* or *Edit > Undo.*
h3. Expected Results

Roll back to the last action.
h3. Actual Results

The editor undo the previous action.
h3. Notes

This issue occurs on macOs and Windows.
h3. Workaround

Use command/Ctrl + Z
fields.summary: Undo showing a different behavior when using Edit>Undo on macOS or right click > Undo on Windows on Confluence pages.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not possible to resize images in blog posts and pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Confluence site using the new editor for blog posts, create one
# Add an image
# Click the image

h3. Expected Results

You would see buttons that would allow you to resize the image

h3. Actual Results

There are buttons that allow you to change the image's display in reference to the text (Aligned to Left, Right, etc)
But there is not way to define the image's size through presets (Small, Medium, Large, Original) or manually inputting its size in pixels.

 !screenshot-2.png!
fields.summary: Not possible to resize images

fields.description:
With the introduction of the new editor in Confluence, when adding tasks it will be added inside of a box, so it will point that this is a task:

 

!task.png|thumbnail!

 

For some users, it's preferable that the task can be included only as a checkbox in the page editor, without a box around it so the same can be interpreted directly as some kind of text that is part of the page. This is a suggestion to allow the tasks model to be changed (with/without a box around it).
fields.summary: Option to Change the Tasks Design in the New Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, in order to retrieve the date picker, the user can use the "//" shortcut key and then, select a date, as we can see in the screenshot below:

!picker.png|thumbnail!

With the introduction of the new editor for blogs, the shortcut no longer brings the date picker. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Blog/Page that will be using the new editor. 
 # Try to use the keyboard shortcut to retrieve the date picker

h3. Expected Results

The shortcut should bring a date picker so the user can select the date.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, as if the user was just inserting text. 
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Use the plus/macro icon in the editor and click on the *Date* option. This will bring the date picker:

 

!date.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date Shortcut Does Not Work in the New Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying and Pasting specific content to other table cells will make cells disappear when published

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On a Confluence page with a table, select one color from the color picker
# Go to one of the table cells, type in some text
# Select the text you've just typed, move to another cell, paste
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The table would be fully published.

h3. Actual Results

The table is missing the cell you've pasted the text to.

h3. Workaround

Avoid using formatted text in tables if you're going to need to copy/paste it.

h3. Notes

* This seems to be affecting coloured text only. Regular text with no formatting doesn't seem to be affected by this bug.
* This is also happening when copying/pasting some non-alphanumerical characters - such as ✔
fields.summary: Copying and Pasting specific content to other table cells will make cells disappear when published

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* The left sidebar of a space won't render the *page tree* if the space's homepage is either restricted or doesn't exist.

h3. Environment  
* adg3.space.pagetree = true
* Space with a homepage restricted *or* space without a homepage

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# On a Confluence instance, navigate to a space which doesn't have a homepage or the homepage is restricted;
# Go to the *Overview* of that space

h3. Expected Results  
* Page tree is rendered in the new format defined by the feature flag _adg3.space.pagetree_, as per the screenshot below:

 !Screenshot at Apr 26 11-17-02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results 
* The following errors are triggered on the console and the left sidebar's page tree keeps on loading endlessly.

 !Screenshot at Apr 26 11-19-39.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 08.56.08.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 08.58.59.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 09.18.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
* Add a homepage to the space;
* Unrestrict the homepage of the space;
fields.summary: Page Tree doesn't load if the homepage is restricted/doesn't exist

fields.description: Please make it available for Cloud. The one you use internally
fields.summary: RSVP Macro for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Text is missing when the image being added in expand macro for a blog.


h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a blog
# Add expand macro
# Add text and image inside the expand macro


h3. Observed Behaviour

The image will be there but not the text.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The image and text should be displayed together.
fields.summary: Text are missing when Image being added inside expand macro in Blog

fields.description:
*Summary*

When using backspace to delete a emoticon inside a bracket for example ((on)) in Confluence editor causing cursor to jump in FireFox

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Open Confluence in FireFox
 # Create a new page and type a sentence such as below {code}sadadsaasdadas (light-off (off))ajsdnlbsaadsdal (light-on (on)) bashdbkasdsa{code}
# Delete the bracket at the first ")"
# The cursor jump to the back

*Expected Results*

The cursor should delete the emoticon without jumping to the back of the sentence.

*Actual Results*

The cursor jump when deleting the first bracket

*Workaround*

Use different browser such as Chrome or Edge
fields.summary: Backspace to delete Emoticon in bracket causes cursor to jump in FireFox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [Google Drive macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview], if the logged user is not the author/owner of the document, a message to "authenticate/Sign in as the user" will be displayed, with a *Sign in to Google* button. Due to [not having options to see the document directly in Confluence|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53356], the user will need to authenticate.

Recently, if the user clicks on this button, the following message will be displayed:

*Sign in with Google temporarily disabled for this app - This app has not been verified yet by Google in order to use Google Sign In.*

!google.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Google Drive for Confluence add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to install the *Google Drive Macro* for Confluence
 # After that, when *editing* a page, insert a *Google Sheets* with a valid URL for a spreadsheet in the user's drive.
# Once added to the page, click on *Publish* to save the changes
# Observe the message and click on *Sign in to Google* 

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to authenticate and see the document, based on Google's permission.

h3. Actual Results
The user is asked to authenticate. After that, a warning screen is shown saying the App is not verified by Google.

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Google Drive for Confluence add-on is not verified by google

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Previewing Pages in New Blog posts renders blank Space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence site using the new editor for blog posts, create a page
# Click *Preview*

h3. Expected Results
It should display the preview of the page.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the preview of the page in a very small window, with a lot of blank space below it.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!    !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Previewing Pages in New Blog Posts renders blank space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Assigned to Me macro isn't rendering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a site with Confluence and Jira, create a page
# Add an *Assigned to Me* macro to this page
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
It would show all issues assigned to the user.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

At the browser's developer console, there's an error message:

{code}
Uncaught Error: jira/moment/moment.jira.i18n missing wrm/data
{code}
fields.summary: Assigned to Me macro isn't rendering

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer has made a page of confluence that he wants to share with his customers, a changelog of their software, so their clients can see the titles of their tickets, but without the possibility of accessing the tickets themselves.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuration on JIRA Issue/Filter macro to display issue's summary for users without Jira access

h3. Workaround
Allow anonymous access to issue on Jira.
fields.summary: Allow configuration to display issue's summary for users without Jira access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a space does have a specific/huge number of pages, the page tree in the sidebar will keep loading and will not provide any results.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space
 # Be sure that this space will contain thousands of pages (specifically, *3000* or more)
 # Access any page

h3. Expected Results

The pages should be displayed under the *Pages* menu in the sidebar.

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar keeps loading.

h3.Workaround
Split the pages into different spaces.
fields.summary: Page Tree Does Not Load if The Space Contains a Huge Amount of Pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Anonymous users are prompted to log in when accessing anonymous space from Ipad browser.

h3. Steps to replicate

* Create a space and make sure it's anonymous (open for public)
* Access the space from Ipad safari browser


h3. Observed Result

The user is prompted to log in

h3. Expected Result

The user should be able to see the space because it's open to public.
fields.summary: Required to login for anonmyous space when browsing from Ipad browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Cloud Confluence documentation for [Add formatting to your page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-formatting-to-your-page-724764836.html] the examples are showing the previous page layout offerings. 

At this time, we now offer both a Fixed Width Single Column Layout (which spans the whole page) or simply a Single Column Layout which is a fixed width:

 !Screen Shot 2018-04-25 at 10.39.10 AM.png|thumbnail! 

In the documentation, you're not able to see this new offering.

h3. Suggested Solution
I propose that we describe the different page layouts available and what they do, and also include the new offering.
fields.summary: Documentation doesn't mention new Single Column and Fixed Width page layouts

fields.description:
I will explain issue with the help of below screenshot.

!image-2018-04-25-10-28-02-429.png|width=217,height=183!

I am able to create Table 1 but not Table 2 as Table 2 is nested table and it is not supported by Confluence.

Here, I have created Table 1, copied it and edited as Table 2 in number list. When I am exporting this page to PDF (PFA for reference), no one line space is seen between Table 2 and numbered list point 2. I have tried ENTER and SHIFT+ENTER options here.

I want to suggest that confluence provides option to add one line space here.
fields.summary: Not able to add one line space between Nested Table and next numbered list item

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not Possible to Add Images to Confluence Questions (and Answers)

h3. Description

There's currently no button to attach images to Confluence Questions (Topics or Answers)
Dragging and dropping also doesn't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to an instance with Confluence Questions installed
# Try to create a new topic/question

h3. Expected Results

* You should have an option to add an image

h3. Actual

* You don't have an option to add an image


 !screenshot-1.png!
fields.summary: Not Possible to Add Images to Confluence Questions (and Answers)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having several Jira Macros within a Confluence page, retrieving more than 1000 unique Jira Issues will throw a Page Not Found error due to a timeout

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In an instance with Confluence and Jira, create a Confluence Page
# In this page, insert several (25+) Jira Charts Macros with different queries - in a way that you may retrieve more than 1000 single Jira Issues
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The page would normally load - possibly taking some time to fetch all the data it has to.

h3. Actual Results

The page keeps loading for around 90 seconds and then, it throws a *Page Not Found* error.
It is possible to see a *504 - Gateway Timeout* error at the developer console.

h3. Workarounds

* Split the page's content into more than one Confluence page - this way, it doesn't have to fetch this much data on each reload.

# Go to the page in Edit Mode: {{https://<YOURSITE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/edit/<PAGEID>}}
# Cut half - or at least a good portion of the page - and paste it into a new one.
# Publish the page
# Repeat this process until the page properly loads.
fields.summary: Having several Jira Macros within a Confluence page, retrieving more than 1000 unique Jira Issues will throw a Page Not Found error due to a timeout

fields.description:
It would be nice to change the color of text that you insert a link for. Instead of being that darker blue, it would be great to have it closer to our company brand with the colors we use.

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Change Color Of Hyperlinked Text

fields.description:
We have images on our homepage of our Confluence Cloud space and have hyperlinked them to other pages. When hovering over the image, instead of showing the pointer finger icon that usually shows when hovering a link, it shows the four arrows icon as if suggesting moving the image.

 

It would be great for it to show the pointer finger icon instead since it is a link to other content so that users are not confused trying to navigate.

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Pointer Finger Icon instead of Four Arrows Icon for images

fields.description:
When creating pages in confluence that have large tables or code blocks, it's nice to nest them in macros like 'expand' or 'code block' that collapse and keep the page minimal until the information is required.

Unfortunately, when editing the page, the macros appear expanded and create an extremely long document that you need to scroll through in order to find the actual lines you wish to edit.

This is an issue because when you enter edit mode, your page is scrolled to the incorrect editing location, since the page is now much larger than in viewing mode with the data collapsed.

 

To avoid this issue and save time and frustration when performing multiple edits, it would be great if the macros collapsed and perhaps maintained the state they were in during viewing mode when the 'edit' button was pressed.

 

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Is-there-is-way-to-collapse-Expand-objects-while-editing-page/qaq-p/131202]
fields.summary: Collapse Framed Macros In Editing Mode

fields.description:
h5. The problem
It's not possible changing the color of the bullets and the expand icons of the Page Tree macro. 

h5. Suggestion
The possibility of editing the colors of the icons.
fields.summary: Page Tree macro: change color of bullets and expand icons
